p: Several reports have described the differential diagnosis of HZ infection and sciatica originating from the lumbar spine. Sprenger De Rover reported that no abnormal MRI findings in the lumbar spine can rule out that sciatica originated in the lumbar spine ( 6). It requires careful examination of the medical history, improvement of physical examination, combined with imaging examination to make a clear diagnosis. Otherwise, it is easy to be misdiagnosed, and the surgery that should not be done brings pain and economic burden to the patient ( 7).
